description: Siberian yarrow (Achillea sibirica) is a drought-tolerant perennial with striking, flat-topped clusters of feathery-looking yellow flowers. It blooms in early summer and its buds are a deep maroon color. It is an essential plant in the dry, sunny gardens of North America due to its excellent drought-tolerance and drought-resilience. Siberian yarrow's tolerance of extreme temperatures make it an ideal choice for shade gardens and cold regions. Its long-lasting, lovely foliage is a long-term burst of color and excellent addition to any garden. It also does not require very much maintenance and requires very little water for survival. Siberian yarrow's beauty and resilience make it a great choice for any garden.
